channel.title: [vb.net/2008] disabling js in a web browser?
channel.description: so how would i do this in this language anyway?

item.title: [vb.net/2008] disabling js in a web browser?
item.dc:creator: @person1936 person1936
item.description:
@person1936 wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:4, topic:215814”]You could just ask, “How do I keep RS from redirecting, etc.”

There was some sort of module for VB6 that does that. Look in Sythe’s VB section.[/quote]
i have long learned that vb6 is alot different than vb.net 2008

Read full topic

item.title: [vb.net/2008] disabling js in a web browser?
item.dc:creator: @person1936 person1936
item.description:
@person1936 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:2, topic:215814”]What the hell is going on in your signature?

Making a web browser with vb.net is beyond easy, since it has like 999999999999 of the things you need prebuilt in because it uses IE modules.

Just google it.[/quote]
i actualy dont know
and i tried googleing it, but i have the web browser but i want to tell it not to allow javascript to execute, because theres js in the page im going to and it redirects you the the home page

Read full topic
